website_summaries.verdict: New Balance 786 v2 is a reasonably-priced option that’s well-equipped for any outdoor court setup. The upgraded upper offers ample ventilation and support, which lets you stay focused on the game and not your foot. This trainer allows you to work on those backhand, forehand, and groundstroke shots while keeping your foot well-cushioned. It’s simply a valuable choice to jumpstart your tennis prowess.
pros: Scores of reviewers affirm that the New Balance 786 v2 offers fabulous lateral support
Heaps of playtesters acknowledge that the underfoot cushioning is exceptionally comfy
Many believe that this footgear offers proper ventilation, especially at the forefoot
Lots of thrilled buyers say this entry-level shoe by New Balance lasts for a good amount of time
A considerable number claim that the tread gives favorable traction on the hard court
According to more than a few wearers, the outsole doesn’t pick up much dirt on the clay court
cons: NB786 v2 has a pointed toe that feels tight according to lots of users

customer_reviews.title: Absolute garbage
customer_reviews.text: I've owned NB tennis shoes previously and been pleased. I compete at a high level and expect a lot from my shoes. When I saw these at this price, I figured I'd scored big time. NB have shot themselves in the foot by offering this shoe. It's absolute garbage. The quality is so poor that the tops of your feet and toes get roughed up by the very low quality material. It doesn't seem to fit the shape of the foot either and you notice this immediately when you start playing in them. Prior to this, I would've said NB made top quality tennis shoes and you couldn't go wrong with the brand. Apparently no longer the case...
customer_reviews.author: Molly Ritter

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality!
customer_reviews.text: There are not very many Extra Wide tennis shoes out there that fit my son. I bought 2 of these for him. However these shoes are the most disappointing NB we have ever had. First, he got a big blister during break-in. Second, all white socks were turned pink after one day in these shoes. After a couple of weeks of on-court only use, the paints on the top were peeling off. I knew New Balance could do better. They used to make great tennis shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Gail L.

customer_reviews.title: I love new balance and have owned a ton of their ...
customer_reviews.text: I love new balance and have owned a ton of their tennis shoes. these are a tad tight in the toe - feel shorter and skinnier than most NB I have owned. I still like them a lot. Wore them during a three set match and my big toes were a little sore so I am hoping that they break in as there is no way I can return them now....
customer_reviews.author: brandon

customer_reviews.title: Best all-around athletic shoes I've ever found!
customer_reviews.text: I have worn New Balance shoes in this style and earlier iterations for nearly 20 years. I use them for running, walking, playing tennis, at the gym, and even when exploring cities on foot. I just can't bring myself to buy a different pair of shoes for every activity, and these do everything equally well. New Balance has changed the model numbers and materials slightly over the years, but they have remained true to the idea of an athletic shoe that does everything. Every year or two until I am too feeble to stand, I will continue to replace my worn-out pair with the latest update.
customer_reviews.author: Savage Doc

customer_reviews.title: A big disappointment - too small !
customer_reviews.text: I have 6 other styles of New Balance Tennis Shoes size 12 EE and they all fit perfectly. This is the first time I've experienced discomfort with New Balance. These are noticably shorter and lower profile than my other styles and I will definitely return them. What's ironic is that I ordered this style based on the recommendation of a New Balance customer service person, who told me they compared well with model 781, which I love but which they naturally no longer produce. I was so confident I ordered two pair.
customer_reviews.author: R.M.S.

customer_reviews.title: Question of quality
customer_reviews.text: The fit is fine. I've played in it on indoor hard court and it was comfortable. I've used New Balance in the past and have been happy with their width. What I didn't realize is that there are various models and the quality is markedly different. This is model 786. I bought this model because the ad mentioned "cushioning" My ageing knees need cushioning on indoor hard courts. They are more cheaply made than my previous ones which I think were model 1006. Bottom line, I'm happy so far but wonder about their longevity.
customer_reviews.author: gwen marder

customer_reviews.title: Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these shoes for pickleball play. I wanted something with a little more cushioning and that held my foot snugly. Yes these shoes are a tiny bit tighter than the other NB tennis shoes but that is what I was looking for. I normally wear a 2E width and I ordered these in the same size and am happy with the fit.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Marinch

customer_reviews.title: 12 1/2 Wide...I am in love
customer_reviews.text: Wow, these are very comfortable shoes and fit my wide foot great. What is really nice is you can buy a a 12 1/2 wide and they fit perfect. I normally buy a 13 when I get shoes which are a little big because 12's are normally a little small. Finally a shoe that bridges the middle ground and in a wide to boot. I am in love! I bought these for playing pickle ball and find that I wear them much more than I thought that I would. I have not bought a pair of non-running shoes in many years, excepting of course shoes for work, and find these to be great for normal day to day wear.
customer_reviews.author: BMac

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe with a few issues.
customer_reviews.text: I give these shoes only 4 stars because 1) I don't care much for the "plastic like" material these shoes are covered with and 2) I did not care for the very strong smell of formaldehyde when I first put them on. The smell is gone now, men it took a few weeks to wear it off. The fit and the support is good - I use them for Pickle Ball.
customer_reviews.author: Danwood

customer_reviews.title: Good tennis shoes
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tennis shoe for my slightly wide, mostly flat feet. As a 3.5 player, movement is critical and I would buy these shoes again after wearing for over a month.
customer_reviews.author: htmcc

customer_reviews.title: How Wide Is Wide
customer_reviews.text: Normally I wear a 2E but after reading other reviews and at the time only 4E was available I took a chance and ordered 4E. I am glad I did. The shoe fits perfectly. I believe a 2E in this case would have been too snug. Depending upon country of origin the shoes are being made narrower. Buyer beware. Other than that the shoes are great.
customer_reviews.author: BklynBob

customer_reviews.title: Runs at least .5 too small
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing New Balance tennis sneakers sized 11.5D for decades - this is the first shoe that isn't sized consistently. Had to return a pair sized 11.5D as too small, and the 12D replacement is barely big enough. I use orthotics so I know exactly the size/shape that the shoe should be, and this one is clearly running small in length, and also a bit small in the toe box. The shoe is otherwise comfortable. Time will tell if the sole is durable with hard court use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P

customer_reviews.title: Solid tennis shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for father. He is elderly and has wide feet - he commented that the shoe felt tight at the lateral portions of his feet but I believe this is the extra support as tennis shoe. He has had zero issues using them for tennis and felt very stable running with them on the court. Definitely do not suggest using as a daily shoe.
customer_reviews.author: rook

customer_reviews.title: Width sizing is off
customer_reviews.text: I've had two previous pairs of New Balance MC806's. Both pair were 2E wide - both pair fit my feet with adequate room. This new pair of 786 are too small. Its discouraging to find out that New Balance can be so off on their sizing. After all, the width sizing that New Balance offers is the only reason I buy them. All other aspects of the shoes are inferior to nearly all the other manufacturer's tennis shoes. But, no one other than New Balance has as many shoes with width sizing.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick S. Parks

customer_reviews.title: that the shoes run a bit narrow
customer_reviews.text: I like the cushioning the most. I am normally a size 12 but ordered a size 13 which was still too narrow somewhat, The foot opening seems smaller and I do’t use the last tie but all in all I like the shoe and for me the size 13 compensated almost for the manufacturers narrow shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: I wore my new tennis sneakers twice and my right ...
customer_reviews.text: I wore my new tennis sneakers twice and my right foot was in pain for after I played tennis. I have bought New Balance sneakers for many many years, so many, I can't remember when I started. I developed heel pain before but I don't think it was the sneaker then. I am not sure why this is now a problem, but I am afraid to play or wear them now. I wear orthotics and have for years, so this is not the issue. Do you have suggestions as to what I could do? Should I try to exchange them for a different model? Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Alain S.

customer_reviews.title: If the shoe fits
customer_reviews.text: Order one full size in length and one full size wider and you will be happy with this shoe. Otherwise, you will have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Super D

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes, however ... the sizing has CHANGED (smaller)
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing NB tennis shoes for 20 years & I have always been a 12 2E. I still have my last pair and they fit perfectly, however NB has changed their manufacturer and they are no longer using the same sizing. This is on many of their shoes. It looks like I will need a 13 2E to get the same size I have been wearing in the past. Not withstanding the size issue ... NB have been great shoes!
customer_reviews.author: Time Traveler

customer_reviews.title: A Top-Quality Tennis Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Though this shoe was too wide for my foot, out of all the tennis sneakers I tried this season (addidas, ASICS, Prince, Babolat) this shoe was the best constructed. All leather, quality double-stitching at stress areas, ultra-wide radial, ample interior cushioning, and thick soles with toe protection (for foot drag serving at the baseline).
customer_reviews.author: Mixhael

customer_reviews.title: My faves
customer_reviews.text: Don't stop making leather tennis shoes! This is my go to shoe for tennis. Make all the mesh shoes you want, but a 225 pound guy like me loves (& needs) the extra support afforded by leather!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Sneve

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not as long nor as wide as the same-sized New Balance shoes I've purchased in the past. I haven't had the shoes long enough to comment on durability. Don't know why New Balance has changed the shoes, but for me (a long-time New Balance purchaser) it means I'll be looking at other shoe manufacturers from now on. Maybe New Balance should have kept manufacturing their shoes in the US.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Pointier, narrower and shallower toe box than my beloved NB MC656, but still just as squeaky.
customer_reviews.text: Pointier, narrower and shallower toe box than my beloved NB MC656 I wore for many years. Bah! Bring back the 656! They do continue one negative from the 656, though. When you come in from any wet conditions onto any sort of linoleum or tiles, these particular herringbone soles squeak with each step like you just stepped on Minnie Mouse.
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Henerey

customer_reviews.title: Good cushioning and grippy soles
customer_reviews.text: This model of New Balance has some extra cushioning which my feet appreciate. I wear a wide size and most New Balance court shoes in this size fit me well. The tread wears slowly and gives good traction on hard courts. I've been wearing this brand for 10+ years and haven't been disappointed yet.
customer_reviews.author: B. Stokes

customer_reviews.title: Perfect width for 4E extra wide, which is becoming harder to find
customer_reviews.text: Its getting harder and harder to find XL width tennis shoes, I seem to only find them from New Balance and even those are mostly sold out when I look.
customer_reviews.author: Markham T.

customer_reviews.title: I did buy the 2e width still too small, ...
customer_reviews.text: I did buy the 2e width still too small, wanted to return shoes, fed-ex gave me a price of $ 26.85 to ship to ca, I did notice shoes come from asia then to canada and shipped from California, shoe sizing is way to small,, would not use road runner sport again
customer_reviews.author: lutz hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Smaller fit then usual
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing New Balance for decade and always order the same size. This specific model fits a little smaller then usual both width and length. I have to use a thinner sock with them. Although the support is extremely good it will likely expand after wearing them a few time.
customer_reviews.author: Serge Roy

customer_reviews.title: They fit well and were instantly comfortable. The rubber sole looks good
customer_reviews.text: They fit well and were instantly comfortable. The rubber sole looks good, thick, and has lots of traction - which is what I mainly care about being a tennis player. The only knock on these sneaks is that they are ugly, the boss's kid must have designed these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Korp

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase to play a sport..
customer_reviews.text: Played tennis with them...ruined my feet. I tried to return them but they wouldn't take back because i used them.....dont buy to play a sport.....
customer_reviews.author: SUSO D.

customer_reviews.title: Pickleball
customer_reviews.text: I play Pickleball five days a week. The shoes I was wearing were killing my feet, especially my toes. I’d always worn New Balance walking shoes so I figured why not try their court shoes. Best footwear move ever. My feet feel great now even with extensive play. Plenty of toe space. I especially like that I feel more confident with my footing on the court, especially at my age(a young 67).
customer_reviews.author: DAVID EDWARDS

customer_reviews.title: Far too short fit
customer_reviews.text: Ordered them for a friend, who had another older pair of New Balance tennis shoes. After going through the reviews of other buyers complaining about the too small short fit we decided to go for half a size bigger. Even this is far too small!!! We should have gone for even bigger. He can't even wear normal tennis socks. Apart from being too short the shoe itself has a good arch- and heel support, and the typical New Balance characteristics.
customer_reviews.author: Constanze Engl

customer_reviews.title: I like NB shoes but their measurements are inconsistent
customer_reviews.text: I like NB shoes but their measurements are inconsistent. I wear a 9.5E in US measurement. The NB #786 I ordered was a 10, 2E, and was too small; width & length. Road Runner Sports does not pay for return postage.
customer_reviews.author: William Pearce

customer_reviews.title: Quality and size maybe issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had many pairs. Those made outside the USA can be poor quality. One pair had the soles coming unbonded after a couple months. Also better order one size larger if not US made. Read carefully the reviews and where made.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Cloudt

customer_reviews.title: SIZE MATTERS
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn New Balance since I ran college cross country in the late ‘70’s. Never had a problem with fit until manufacturing was moved to South East Asia a few years ago. New Balance quality control has fallen off significantly. They still design a great shoe but widths are not widely available (see what I did there), and sizing is a real shortcoming, as well. Only buy these where you can try them on, unless you like running to the post office!
customer_reviews.author: Charles T. Carr III

customer_reviews.title: but the 11 would probably be better. The shoe is very good so far
customer_reviews.text: If I could do it again, I'd probably go with size 11, not the 10.5. Light socks and I am ok, but the 11 would probably be better. The shoe is very good so far, my playing time is pretty light but will be increasing. Cushioning is good.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A Curtis

customer_reviews.title: New Balance what's happend?
customer_reviews.text: This is the third or fourth pair of NB786's I purchased from Amazon. I've had to adjust the lacing to accommodate my 1/2 width larger right foot. The NB last has worked well in the past. This pair seems different and I'm trying to find a suitable lacing adjustment. I haven't given up yet I'll try once or twice more before I give up. This version has shorter laces which may affect the adjustment. Either this pair is an outlier or NB has changed the last. I may not be confident in more online purchasing of NB shoes. I'll update this review in one or two weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Al S

customer_reviews.title: The padding behind the heel area is much thicker than ...
customer_reviews.text: The padding behind the heel area is much thicker than previous versions of NB's shoes. I returned the order and reordered a half size larger than usual in order to get a size that fit properly. Perhaps they should have increased the length of the sole to accommodate the additional heel padding so people can order their usual size shoes.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: Smart
customer_reviews.text: The other manufacturers are definitely missing out by not offering wider shoes. The herringbone sole has the right dimensions. These shoes do not pick up enough clay to make them heavy. Thanks New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: CJS

customer_reviews.title: Not quite wide enough througout length of shoe
customer_reviews.text: The toe box area is wide enough but the middle of the foot was too skinny. I wanted to get my husband wide shoes all the way from heel to toe. He is wearing them due to necessity, but I am trying a different brand to get one wider.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wide toe space
customer_reviews.text: The most comfortable sneaker I have had in some time. I previously had a different brand that got skinnier over time.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scudder

customer_reviews.title: The product is great but i should have sized it half a size ...
customer_reviews.text: First time buying shoes online, sizing is alway a problem, I took a chance. The product is great but i should have sized it half a size wider; The trouble is they don't come any wider. It fits, but my feet swell after an hour of playing and then there is no room to accommodate....
customer_reviews.author: henderson j. poleon

customer_reviews.title: Normally I would wear size 9D for all shoes including ...
customer_reviews.text: Normally I would wear size 9D for all shoes including New Balance shoes. But these tennis shoes were very tight and short even without socks on. Had to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Casual Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I've been using New Balance shoes (cross-training & tennis) for years - bought from Amazon - and have been pleased with all I've gotten. These tennis shoes are very comfortable, and I'm an odd size - 13/4E.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Combes

customer_reviews.title: Nice comfortable shoes
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, very comfortable to wear all day long! Even the laces don't come un-tied like some other shoes do. Would most certainly buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Daveg61

customer_reviews.title: Other than that they seem to be fine shoes.
customer_reviews.text: Narrower than my other shoes that are the same size and width. Other than that they seem to be fine shoes. In addition if I were to order this brand of tennis shoe again I would order a 1/2 size larger
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It appears the new 786 New Balance is running somewhat on the small side
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased in the past several years a couple of the New Balance 786 model court shoes. In each purchase they were 10.5 medium which is my usual shoe size. This pair is much smaller than the previous 10.5 model 786 that I have purchased in the past. It appears that New Balance has shortened the toe box on this model. I have sent back and ordered size 11 medium.
customer_reviews.author: Dezertratz

customer_reviews.title: I liked them a lot.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of court shoes for outdoor Pickleball. I really like them. I have been wearing cross trainers but these are definitely better. I liked them so much I got a second pair just for indoor play.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Leech

customer_reviews.title: nice court shoe for tennis or pickle ball
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected, nice court shoe for tennis or pickle ball
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Too small. Possible counterfeits?
customer_reviews.text: Ordered same size and model as last year. Too small. Returned for 1/2 size larger. Still too small. We think these may be counterfeit Nikes!
customer_reviews.author: Sandilou

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to true 4E. I found this product misleading in terms of width
customer_reviews.author: ATomarc

customer_reviews.title: Size has changed
customer_reviews.text: I order a 9.5 size originally which is the size I have ordered for years. Unfortunately the size has changed size 10 is now the appropriate size to order if you normally ordered a 9.5.
customer_reviews.author: John R Tally

customer_reviews.title: 2E Was Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: I had to return the shoe because the 786v2 2E was way too tight. I had previously purchased the same size and it fit.
customer_reviews.author: NaplesRoger

customer_reviews.title: short and narrow
customer_reviews.text: smaller than all other NB tennis shoes I had in past - be advised Then ordered 1/2 size larger and all is now perfect
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great tennis shoe. I've worn it for a couple of matches and it's stabile and comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe but order bigger
customer_reviews.text: Small in both width and length. Ordered larger on both to begin with based on feedback and they barely fit. Go up a full size and double your normal width. Otherwise these are a great quality shoe! Fair value for price if they are durable.
customer_reviews.author: Steve P

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good looking but this pair is tight compared to my last pair of this same shoe.
customer_reviews.author: HobieGeek

customer_reviews.title: Not correct size sent
customer_reviews.text: I have worn New Balance for a long time. These sneakers were supposed to be 4E wide and they were no where near that size. Also, the sole of the sneaker didn't seem very supportive. I bought the NB 806's and that is a much better shoe and fit as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Scully

customer_reviews.title: I was terribly disappointed in the lack of quality
customer_reviews.text: My son wore these for tennis 2 weeks and both shoes came apart in toes at the seams. I was terribly disappointed in the lack of quality.
customer_reviews.author: R D

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a size 15wide. Leather, well made, very comfortable. Should last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy  Wienecke

customer_reviews.title: NB is a great shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have worn NB for 10+ years and have never been disapointed
customer_reviews.author: Frank Scanlon

customer_reviews.title: 2nd pair of model 786 that are small and natrow ...
customer_reviews.text: 2nd pair of model 786 that are small and natrow. I've worn this NB model for 2 years and these are definitely different
customer_reviews.author: john riley

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Update - thought these shoes might stretch with use but that did not happen. Have worn them four times and I am done. Pinching in the toe area. Right big toe is battered and bruised. Have used New Balance shoes forever. The 656 11.5 EE always fit great. Not sure what the problem is with these shoes but have read other reviews and see that many people have the same problem in the toe area. Ordering something else.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as comfortable as some previous NB tennis shoes, but not bad at all.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent G

customer_reviews.title: ... sneaker for several years now and have been very satisfied. In showing them to my podiatrist
customer_reviews.text: I've been using the NB tennis sneaker for several years now and have been very satisfied. In showing them to my podiatrist, he stated that it's a good fit for someone who has a high arch, a wide front foot and a narrow heel. The only minor concern was the tongue area where the length between opposite eyelets seemed to be longer than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Domenick Fabrizio

customer_reviews.title: Nice and wide
customer_reviews.text: I wear extra wide width shoes and New Balance fit the bill. I can even wear them with padded socks. They give me good foot support and just the right traction for playing indoor pickleball.
customer_reviews.author: Susan M.

customer_reviews.title: Snug ... but should work after breaking.
customer_reviews.text: They fit snug with thin socks... a little narrow, but should break in fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Funny, I ordered these shoes in 10EE size but ...
customer_reviews.text: Funny, I ordered these shoes in 10EE size but what came was in a Stetson box, was brown, tall, with a heel, and no laces, and in size 9D. Someone messed up.
customer_reviews.author: BlueInfidel

customer_reviews.title: Not wide enough
customer_reviews.text: Waayyy too narrow suppose to be 13 4E far from it. I already threw the packaging away now I'm stuck with them
customer_reviews.author: Mega ram

customer_reviews.title: I own the NB 623 size 10 4E. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I own the NB 623 size 10 4E. I ordered a 10.5 4E after reading the reviews and the shoe size was still to small.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Iannuccilli

customer_reviews.title: The fit was as expected but I have not yet ...
customer_reviews.text: The fit was as expected but I have not yet worn the shoes to play pickle ball. The c;cushioning around the ankle seems a bit bulky but may be OK. Limited to 3 stars because they are untested in action.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly right out of the box, good support and traction.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: This model runs quite narrow
customer_reviews.text: This particular New Balance shoe seems to run quite a bit narrower than the normal NB shoes I buy. It would probably be great in a 2e width.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Erickson

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: To tight! Sent the shoes back they refuse to refund our money
customer_reviews.author: brenda brewer

customer_reviews.title: Their size recommendation wizard recommended size 10
customer_reviews.text: Way too small. Their size recommendation wizard recommended size 10. I have worn New Balance size 10 before. This model wasn't even close.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dweck

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for tennis players in hard courts
customer_reviews.text: I am a tennis player. Thus is the 3rd time i bought those NB W786 shoes via the internet, abd i am very pleased with my choice
customer_reviews.author: Rothschild Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Tennis shoes for Tennis
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are great they fit excellent and are very comfortable on and off the court.
customer_reviews.author: Don S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Cushioning in New Balance Tennis Shoes
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have almost no mid-sole for cushioning. They have a sole and an inner sole , but no mid-sole. Playing tennis in these shoes is going to cause major damage to most people. New Balance saved a lot of money by not putting a mid-sole on these shoes, maybe that is the new trend.
customer_reviews.author: William C Walker Jr

customer_reviews.title: Sharp Looking !!
customer_reviews.text: They arrived quickly on 8-4-2017 and I've worn these NB MC786 v2--(size 15-4E) tennis shoes twice since 8-5-2017. At this time I find them to fit my feet as I wanted and expected. There's no pinching , tight fitting spots , or etc. evident in the shoes. They're a comfortable fit , stylistic and looking good. Right now , I like them very much !!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: These are somewhat more narrow than my previous New Balance ...
customer_reviews.text: These are somewhat more narrow than my previous New Balance tennis sneakers. Both new and old were marked 12 4E, but the new sneakers are definitely not as wide across the ball of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Doodles

customer_reviews.title: Order 1/2 size up!
customer_reviews.text: I wear thick socks so I ordered a half-size larger and they’re still a bit snug. However these are good shoes for less $50.
customer_reviews.author: Hud1

customer_reviews.title: and the fit that I have is perfect. The quality is what I expectd for New ...
customer_reviews.text: Reviews which I read before ordering stated that the shoe fit runs a bit small. I allowed for some extra room, and the fit that I have is perfect. The quality is what I expectd for New Balance.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Parrillo

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoe
customer_reviews.text: I have this shoe for years and am satisfied. Long lasting sole. I use it for pickelball. Inside play it will last forever, outside it is long lasting.
customer_reviews.author: David Lessnau

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feels good. Perfect fit substituting supplied innersole with Dr
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels good. Perfect fit substituting supplied innersole with Dr. Scholl's Sport gel insoles.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my husband love this shoe. it's the only one that has a true size....
customer_reviews.author: brenda kneebone

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Not true to size, therefore did not fit. requires shipping plus shipping on return If reordered another shipping when seller did not state this model ran small.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon Christopher

customer_reviews.title: extra wide
customer_reviews.text: I need the extra wide shoes because of my fat feet. most of shoes are not wide enough. I am glad that this shoe offers the extra wide option.
customer_reviews.author: colin

customer_reviews.title: ... wide as I had hoped for but otherwise a good shoe.
customer_reviews.text: Toe box not quite as wide as I had hoped for but otherwise a good shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kona irondoc

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully this is the size 8. 5 that I'm ...
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully this is the size 8.5 that I'm reviewing on. (it would be helpfull to show the size/order) Since this order replaced one with a size 8 which I normally take if wide width NB.
customer_reviews.author: Louis U. Valanzola

customer_reviews.text: First time I have bought shoes online, fit as expected, and seem to be holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Ted E. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: Waking on Air
customer_reviews.text: I have hard to fit feet. The shoe fits fine-
customer_reviews.author: TommyC

customer_reviews.title: Comfy with good support
customer_reviews.text: Been wearing New Balance tennis shoes for over a decade. These are comfortable as usual, with good support. I prefer the NB's becuase they have a large toe box than other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Skytraveler

customer_reviews.title: Good Shoes
customer_reviews.text: This my second pair of NB 786V2. I like them better than the K Swiss I had been wearing because they are more durable and just as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Bjork

customer_reviews.title: 2E does not mean what it used to mean
customer_reviews.text: I need to return them. The width of 2E is much smaller than my other 2E New Balance tennis shoes. Measuring the bottoms of the shoes at wide part show new ones much thinner. I would be willing to try 4E.
customer_reviews.author: GOJA

customer_reviews.title: good shoe, great price,
customer_reviews.text: the third pair of NB, play twice a week, last close to a year
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: 4E? No Way!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely NOT extra wide as advertised. Also appear cheaply made. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Oblivious IV

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe for Hardcourt Tennis...But...
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet. VERY wide feet. So, I have to either buy Asics or New Balance. I always order 4E, and out of all the 4E shoes I've ever ordered from New Balance, these feel a little more narrow. Fortunately, I'm probably not a true 4E, but more of a 3.75E. It does feel a bit more snug than other extra wide shoes I've owned, but it still fits me. As a tennis player, my feet will swell just a bit after hitting the courts for a couple hours, which is natural. So far, these shoes have been great for me. However, if you're a TRUE 4E wide wearer, you might be in trouble if you're very active.
customer_reviews.author: Zenjiro K.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for the price
customer_reviews.text: Played in them right out of the box. Great fit, was concerned after reading previous reviews but found the sizing 10D to be very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Mark C Adams

customer_reviews.title: Great Comfort & Looks.  Narrower than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable out of the box. Great looking shoe!! A bit narrow for a "D" but I am wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: GWeiss

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA!
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA! Great tennis shoes, and what other brand of sneakers are made in USA?
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: but just not comfortable. Bind on the top of the
customer_reviews.text: Fit ok...but just not comfortable. Bind on the top of the toes
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed that only new balance makes 10
customer_reviews.text: A little tight but very useable. I am disappointed that only new balance makes 10.5 4e. And only the one pair that I bought in anything other than white. Colored tennis shoes are now in but none other than these available for my wide feet. I got to believe there are plenty others with wide feet that might want something more colorful than tradional white.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: New Balance Men's 786 Tennis Shoes
product_meta.description: The new 786v2 exhibits what New Balance tennis represents and will continue to represent, quality and comfort in an authentic tennis silhouette. Technology: Abzorb
